reviewText: What happenned to my piece of the cake? Gimme A Break!" Well folks, we can have our cake & eat it too with VEI's Gimme A Break The Complete Series. VEI released the first two seasons in their own individual sets but stopped at season 3. Fans demanded more and VEI did the fans right. Instead of continuing on season by season and leaving fans hanging and waiting after each, VEI decided the best route was to release the entire series in a complete series set. Some may not think this is fair after buying the first two sets, but did you happen to notice the price for this set? It's list price is $60 but of course amazon is offering it at a nice discount. Assuming each season costs $20 (which wasn't the list price when released by the way-think more like $35)then the whole series of 6 seasons should cost $80. VEI took that into account and priced this complete set at ONLY $60 (and that's before the discount!) This set is VERY reasonably priced. No one should be complaining. If you waited for each season to be released season by season you would have ended up paying way more than the 40 something dollars you will pay for this beautiful and complete set!Just to touch on the most important facts about this set (which has thankfully been mentioned & confirmed in many other reviews) this set is just what it says it is COMPLETE. Every episode of GAB that ever aired, just as they aired during their original network run on NBC is here. There are no syndication cuts, these ARE the original episodes. From season three on the original bumpers are even included. All the songs sang by Nell, the cast & guest stars, in additional to the few actual studio master recordings of songs played during the episodes, ARE included UNCUT. Never would I have thought it possible at the price this set is! The video is very clear and the audio is for the most part pretty good. A few episodes have less than perfect audio, but if you turn your volume up, it's not really a problem. The episodes from seasons one and two are the same that were on the original seasons one & two sets. This includes the bonus episodes of Kate & Allie & The Stockard Channing Show. No other bonus features are on this set, but with the complete episodes (many with bumpers) it doesn't really matter. Even the controversial "Baby Of The Family" episode is complete and untouched.The set consists of 18 discs, with 2 seasons each housed in sturdy plastic amary cases. The three plastic cases are housed in an outer cardboard box with the a picture of Nell, the girls, the chief & Joey. The outer box is a bit flimsy, but with the cases inside it's not a problem. The box looks beautiful, but even better, the amaray cases have different pictures of Nell & cast members from the appropriate seasons. The backs of the cases give the episode listings for each disc, along with original airdate. Each amaray case holds 6 discs, and the discs inside each case have pictures of Nell & cast.This set is region 1, which means it plays fine on American DVD players. The only difference is that the set is only sold via Canada, where VEI has the rights. For anyone holding out waiting for a release beyond season 1 in the US, you will have a long wait. No one has picked up this series yet and with the complete series now available from VEI it is even more unlikely anyone will. Get this set now before it's very hard to find! At this price it's doubtful too many fans will resist. And besides why should they? In this case we can have our cake and eat it too!***Note as others have said, you can buy this directly from amazon.ca if third party sellers are overcharging on amazon.com.  Amazon.ca ships to the US but the shipping will be slightly higher.  Either way, you should be able to enjoy this set for around $55 US dollars including shipping (amazon.ca currently lists at $44.99 but that is subject to change).***
summary: What happenned to my piece of the cake?  It's right here in GAB the Complete Series
Title: N/A

reviewText: Gimme a Break: I sure deserve it...As a baby of the '80s I still have very fond memories of watching the groundbreaking TV show "Gimme a Break!" on Saturday nights. Ms. Nell Carter (may she rest in peace) was always so funny and sweet and often made such a big splash in every scene she was in.Unless you enjoy paying 3 times the markup, get your set from Amazon Canada (where it almost made it to the top, peaking at #14!). I purchased this the day it was released and it arrived within just a couple of days (they are quicker than regular Amazon dot com!) The price is exceptional. And so is the quality.Update: I noticed some of the merchants have since dropped the price of the GAB! set slightly. I still recommend buying from Amazon Canada though because they are quicker (and their price is much better), it's been my experience that the sellers on here conducting third-party transactions just don't move quick enough. I got my set from Amazon Canada and it shipped out within hours of my order being placed and arrived in 2 days flat. Now where else can you go for a deal like that?Included in this set are a total of 18 discs. There aren't any special features (besides a few bonus eps of some throwaway '80s sitcoms) but that doesn't matter because for the first time we have the entire series of GAB! on DVD. This includes a total of 137 eps, unedited and complete, over the course of 6 seasons (3 discs per season).All of the discs include nice menus which have each ep listed with a screen shot imposed of it, and starting with Season 3 all of the menus on all of the discs include the theme song playing in the background.Please be sure to check out the scans I posted of each of the covers included in the set, as well as the back cover of the bookcase and some of the discs.Yes, it is dated and hokey and corny at times, but watching GAB! again has brought back so many memories. First of all, I love the opening credits. Nell had such a beautiful signing voice and could really carry a tune. And I love the part in the opening credits (taken from the first ep) when Nell dramatically jumps up and down when the Chief pulls out his gun to lock it up. Pure Nell.Over the span of it's run the series tackled many tough subjects, such as death, depression, diet and weight loss, s-e-x, smoking and marriage. Remember, GAB! was on during the golden era of "very special eps" so it's no coincidence that just about every ep had a message and a moral.Nell was always the voice of reason and the voice that everyone heard the loudest. She was cook, maid, seamstress, babysitter, friend, listener and surrogate mother to her entire extended family. And like her counterpart, Nell Carter was such a talented actress that could do so much, she was a fine dramatic actress a wonderful singer and dancer and entertainer. And I have to admit it is somewhat sad watching her now, but at least we have Nell's legacy preserved on this fabulous DVD set.GAB! included a revolving door of very talented supporting players, such as Lara Jill Miller (who often got the most screen time out of all of the girls), Lauri Hendler and Kari Michaelsen. The late and much loved Dolph Sweet, Howard Morton and John Hoyt also all gave exceptionally funny performances. Mr. Sweet especially worked so well with Nell; they just had such a wonderful chemistry. And starting with season 3, Telma Hopkins (who is still very much alive, and is currently staring on the series "Are We There Yet?") and Joey Lawrence joined the series.Some of my favorite eps from the series are probably yours as well. And these include: Nell Goes Home - after leaving her family as a teenager Nell returns home to see her father one last time while he's on his deathbed, Samantha Steals a Squad Car - Samantha says a vulgar word then takes off in a police car after her father goes after her, Nell Goes to Jail - Nell finally gets to have her cake and eat it too when she gets the last laugh with the phone company, Porko's II - with the help of her friends from her diet club, Nell saves the life of a recovering overeater, and Cat Story - this was actually broadcast live as a special promotional event and what I really liked about this ep is how the entire cast was included together in this ep because it was one of the last times they were all seen together prior to Dolph Sweet's passing.Get the complete GAB! series and experience all of love, laughs, tears and trouble again. You will not be disappointed. Remember, you are what you watch.
summary: I finally know where I belong
Title: N/A

reviewText: *NOTE* As another reviewer wrote, do not buy from 3rd party sellers who are doubling the price of this set. Go to Amazon.ca and get it for under $45. When you consider that works out roughly to less than $8 a season, this set is a steal. The discs are all region 1 and will play in US DVD players. Also, this allows VEI to make a profit and they have been doing a good job releasing material the US companies won't touch, like seasons of "McMillan and Wife" and "The Snoop Sisters" as well as the Complete Series of "Kate and Allie". Thank you.**A Toronto-based company called VEI first acquired the rights to "Gimme a Break" back in Spring 2006 and released Season One just a few months after Universal did the same in the U.S.Universal, however, never bothered with a follow-up while VEI brought viewers Season Two in January 2007.Since then, it seemed as though "Gimme a Break" had fallen off the DVD radar. There were rumours in 2008/09 that a series set was on its way, but nothing was set in stone, until now.Proving once again that the smaller companies are the go-to people for Classic TV on DVD, whether it be the '50s, '60s, '70s, or in this case, '80s, VEI is to be commended for putting out the complete Six Seasons in one fell swoop.I wish all my favorite shows would get this kind of DVD treatment.VEI also recently brought us "Kate and Allie: The Complete Series" for a price point under $40. Some hold-outs are still waiting for Universal to do the same in the U.S. (They may be holding their breath: Universal never got past Season One on this show either). I cannot understand some U.S. customers' hesitation in ordering from Amazon.ca when the DVDs are all Region 1 and will be compatible in all North American players. However, it's their loss.The same can be said of "Gimme a Break: The Complete Series". There are no compatibility issues with these discs so those skeptical U.S. buyers should pick this up while they can. VEI's release of "The Stockard Channing Show" quickly went out of print and became hard to find just two years after release.The first two seasons of this show were my favorite when it was just Nell, The Chief and the three girls.Season Three brought a new '80s-synth theme song and the arrival of little Joey Lawrence as the orphan boy Nell eventually adopts. Telma Hopkins also became a regular as Nell's best friend Addy, with whom Nell gets into many Laverne-and-Shirley type predicaments. Addy's first appearance in "Nell's Friend" remains one of the best, funniest scripts the cast ever played.In Season Five, Dolph Sweet who played Chief Carl Kanisky passed away and the show began to flounder.For the sixth and final season, the producers moved Nell, Addy, Joey (and his little brother Matthew) to New York, where a young Rosie O'Donnell joins the cast.Many of the jokes are lame and the situations predictable. However, Nell Carter does have the personality and charisma to evelate the show, and the cast work well together. Dolph Sweet has the thankless task of playing straight man and does so admirably.Of the three girls, I always liked Lauri Hendler as brainy wallflower Julie the best, with her dry, observational humor, though Kari Michaelson and Lara Jill Miller do have their moments as boy-crazy, somewhat defiant Katie, and pubescent tomboy Samantha, respectively.Though not one of the best-written or acted sitcoms of the '80s (It's certainly no "Cheers" or "Golden Girls") there's something comforting about "Gimme a Break".The outer box is not as sturdy as I would have liked, but that's my only real complaint about the packaging. The artwork is basic but nice and they matched the correct cast photos with each volume. Each snap-case securely houses 6 discs that contain two seasons each.For those times when you crave a small dose of '80s nostalgia, this set will surely satisfy your appetite.Kudos to VEI for finally coming through and also for not making us wait for season-by-season volumes.
summary: All Classic TV on DVD Should Be Released Like This

reviewText: I wish they still made television shows like this! This is one of my all time favorite shows from the 80's! The show was simply outstanding! It also got better and better as the seasons continued! I really enjoyed the show more when Nell moved to New York! Television from the 80's is a gem!

reviewText: This item is okay, but if the individual seasons are available I would go for them. I had forgotten why when the show was ending I pretty much stopped watching it. It wasn't really funny by the fifth season and the sixth/last season of the show had even less funny episodes. It's a comedy and towards the end of the show I think they forgot that. I know you have seriousness even in a comedy but the ones that were supposed to be funny in the end weren't. At least not to me. I am not sorry I got the whole series since the entire show isn't on DVD yet but I would strongly recommend you think hard before purchasing. It did have some hard hitting episodes and they were handled well. I really enjoyed them but the funny ones are the ones I am complaining about. They weren't funny and I have a sense of humor.
